channel.title: We have returned, again.
channel.description: to make a super long story short (we have the worst luck in the history of the internet) we had a bit of router trouble at our data center. some head banging and hours later we now bring you back the website at faster speeds. sorry about that guys :3

item.title: We have returned, again.
item.dc:creator: rm249
item.description:
Haha. Well it’s on the new server now, see the other thread at https://forums.blackmesasource.com/showthread.php?t=2991 for more about that

Read full topic

item.description:
rm249:

Just ordered a new server today, faster CPU, faster network port, RAID 1, it’ll be nice

You should get one with a GPU so even the main server can play BM when it’s out.

item.title: We have returned, again.
item.dc:creator: jambo
item.description:
mattemuse:

This is what gives me the fear: visiting blackmesasource.com on Jan 24th, seeing the giant throbbing purple banner ad that says “CLICK ME TO DOWNLOAD BM, FAGGOT” and then immediately being sent to a 404 screen for the next 72 hours as a million people try to follow the link at once.

Sure, maybe its on rapidshare or whatever, but if this site goes down, how will that information be distributed?

Of course, if its on Steam, problem solved…:freeman:

It won’t just be on Steam or just be on the main site. It’ll be fucking EVERYWHERE!

Read full topic

item.title: We have returned, again.
item.dc:creator: Slyr
item.description:
I was only here for two of these type of things.
I was scared when i couldn’t get here earlier, but i knew resident BM:S geniuses would fix eet.
Thanks Hubicorn!

Read full topic

item.title: We have returned, again.
item.dc:creator: mattemuse
item.description:
JKMan723:

having multiple uploads on one site and multiple uploads on another would drastically reduce the amount of time people will be on the BMS forums.

This is what gives me the fear: visiting blackmesasource.com on Jan 24th, seeing the giant throbbing purple banner ad that says “CLICK ME TO DOWNLOAD BM, FAGGOT” and then immediately being sent to a 404 screen for the next 72 hours as a million people try to follow the link at once.

Sure, maybe its on rapidshare or whatever, but if this site goes down, how will that information be distributed?

Of course, if its on Steam, problem solved…:freeman:

item.title: We have returned, again.
item.dc:creator: Hubicorn
item.description:
The server is back online. A fsck from an external Linux system was able to correct the detected file system errors that we found on the servers hard drive.

As we have returned, we might have to plan some downtime in the near future (the next few hours) as our hard drive contains some bad sectors. For the moment that data is remapped to other clean sectors. We will up to RAID-1 with another 250 gig hard drive and re-install the OS. I will let you all know when we will be doing this.

Read full topic

item.title: We have returned, again.
item.dc:creator: Imonfire
item.description:
We are back again! Nice work Hubi!

Read full topic

item.title: We have returned, again.
item.dc:creator: JKMan723
item.description:
mattemuse:

True. Josh Hubi, how confident are you that your web hosting will remain up during the massive influx of people that are going to try to download BMS the day its released?

Or, there could be 2-4 mirrors on sites such as Mediafire, Rapidshare (Although I’m not sure about file-size limit on this one), MegaUpload, and a few others. Sure there is the issue of having to create “Pro” accounts, but having multiple uploads on one site and multiple uploads on another would drastically reduce the amount of time people will be on the BMS forums.

Read full topic

item.title: We have returned, again.
item.dc:creator: Xilefian
item.description:
The_Assassin47:

Whenever this happens, I always think, BLACK MESA IS RELEASED! and then Im disappointed.
Glad nothing is lost.

Nice to know I’m not the only one.

The day is saved, now I can skim over the forums for my daily 5-minutes

Read full topic
